title: Ficus aurea
summary: Ficus aurea, commonly known as the Florida strangler fig (or simply strangler fig), golden fig, or higuer√≥n,[3] is a tree in the family Moraceae that is native to the U.S. state of Florida, the northern and western Caribbean, southern Mexico and Central America south to Panama.[4] The specific epithet aurea was applied by English botanist Thomas Nuttall who described the species in 1846.
